  • Method Details

    • i_verify_an_element_exists

      @Then("^I verify (?:the|a|an) (.*?)( does not)?(?: does)? exists?$") public static void i_verify_an_element_exists​(java.lang.String elementName, java.lang.String assertion) throws java.lang.Throwable
      Verifies the given element exists. The given element string is made lower case and whitespaces are replaced with underscores, then it is sent the isDisplayed event and returns true or false. It also has an assertion variable which is set if the words "does not" are used, and it looks for a negative assertion. The word "does" can be used optionally, and was added to support the use of a Scenario Outline which switches between "does" and "does not" in its tests.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify a submit button exists
      • I verify the Plan Dropdown does not exist
      • I verify an area map does exist
      Scenario Outline Example:

      I verify the <element> <Assertion> exist

      Examples: <table summary="Examples"> <tr> <td>| element</td> <td>| Assertion</td> <td>|</td> </tr> <tr> <td>| first dropdown</td> <td>| does</td> <td>|</td> </tr> <tr> <td>| second dropdown</td> <td>| does not</td> <td>|</td> </tr> </table>

      Parameters:
      elementName - String Element to check
      assertion - String "does" or does not" for true or false
      Throws:
      java.lang.Throwable - this exists so that any uncaught exceptions result in the test failing

    • i_verify_the_element_is_selected

      @Then("^I verify the (.*) is( not)? (?:checked|selected)$") public static void i_verify_the_element_is_selected​(java.lang.String elementName, java.lang.String assertion) throws java.lang.Throwable
      Verifies the whether the given element is selected or not. Intended to be used with check boxes and radio buttons. Using the optional word not will check to make sure the item is not checked/selected.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the Yes check box is checked
      • I verify the Female Radio Button is selected
      • I verify the I would like fries with that Check box is not selected
      Parameters:
      elementName - String Element to check
      assertion - String "" or " not" for true or false
      Throws:
      java.lang.Throwable - this exists so that any uncaught exceptions result in the test failing

    • i_verify_an_element_has_an_attribute

      @Then("^I verify (?:the|a|an) (.*) (?:has)?(does not have)? the attribute (.*)$") public static void i_verify_an_element_has_an_attribute​(java.lang.String elementName, java.lang.String assertion, java.lang.String attribute) throws java.lang.Throwable
      Verifies an element has an attribute by asserting the element for the given elementName has the given class attribute.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the table has the attribute "table-striped"
      • I verify the textbox does not have the attribute "listStyleClass"
      • I verify the div has the attribute "container"
      Parameters:
      elementName - String element to inspect
      assertion - String if not null we expect this be true
      attribute - String class attribute to verify
      Throws:
      java.lang.Throwable - this exists so that any uncaught exceptions result in the test failing

    • i_verify_an_element_is_active

      @Then("^I verify (?:the|a|an) (.*) is( not)? active$") public static void i_verify_an_element_is_active​(java.lang.String elementName, java.lang.String assertion) throws java.lang.Throwable
      Verifies an element is active by asserting the element for the given element name has class attribute 'active'

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the menu item for the current page is active
      • I verify the second li element in the accordion is active
      • I verify the password field is not active
      Parameters:
      elementName - String the element to inspect for the active class
      assertion - String if not null we expect this be true
      Throws:
      java.lang.Throwable - this exists so that any uncaught exceptions result in the test failing

    • i_verify_an_element_is_enabled

      @Then("^I verify (?:the|a|an) (.*?) is( not)? enabled$") public static void i_verify_an_element_is_enabled​(java.lang.String elementName, java.lang.String assertion) throws java.lang.Throwable
      Verifies an element is enabled by asserting the element found for the given element name is enabled

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the submit button is not enabled
      • I verify the home link is enabled
      • I verify the link to open a pdf is enabled
      Parameters:
      elementName - String the name of the element
      assertion - String if not null we expect this be true
      Throws:
      java.lang.Throwable - this exists so that any uncaught exceptions result in the test failing

    • i_verify_an_element_is_hidden

      @Then("^I verify (?:the|a|an) (.*?) is( not)? hidden$") public static void i_verify_an_element_is_hidden​(java.lang.String elementName, java.lang.String assertion) throws java.lang.Throwable
      Verifies an element is enabled by asserting the element for the given element name is hidden

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I verify the iframe is hidden
      • I verify the document link is not hidden
      • I verify the data for the user's current plan is not hidden
      Parameters:
      elementName - String the name of the element
      assertion - String if the assertion is not empty we expect it to be hidden
      Throws:
      java.lang.Throwable - this exists so that any uncaught exceptions result in the test failing

    • i_am_redirected_to_the_page

      @Then("^I am (?:redirected to|shown) the (.*) (?:(?:P|p)age|(?:O|o)verlay)$") public static void i_am_redirected_to_the_page​(java.lang.String pageName) throws java.lang.Throwable
      Redirects to the given pageName

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I am redirected to the home page
      • I am redirected to the login page
      • I am shown the member portal pop-up overlay
      Parameters:
      pageName - String the name of the place to redirect to
      Throws:
      java.lang.Throwable - this exists so that any uncaught exceptions result in the test failing

    • i_see_a_new_tab_open_with_the_foo_Page

      @Then("^I see a new tab open with the (.*) Page$") public static void i_see_a_new_tab_open_with_the_foo_Page​(java.lang.String pageName) throws java.lang.Throwable
      Opens the given pageName in a new window

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I see a new tab open with the Home page
      • I see a new tab open with the Login page
      • I see a new tab open with the Google Maps page
      Parameters:
      pageName - String the page to open
      Throws:
      java.lang.Throwable - this exists so that any uncaught exceptions result in the test failing

    • i_open_the_link_in_a_new_tab_and_verify_the_url

      @Then("^I open the (.*?) link in a new tab and verify the URL that loads is (.*?)$") public static void i_open_the_link_in_a_new_tab_and_verify_the_url​(java.lang.String linkName, java.lang.String url) throws java.lang.Throwable
      Verifies that a URL loads in a new window when a named link is clicked.|

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I open the google link in a new tab and verify the url that loads is http://google.com
      • I open the ESPN link in a new tab for verfiy the url is http://go.espn.com
      • I open the Pharmacy Benefits link in a new window and verify the url is https://testsite.com/pharamacy_benefits
      Parameters:
      linkName - String The text of the link. NOT a PageElement object name.
      url - String the URL expected to be loaded.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Throwable - Passes through any errors to the executing code.

    • i_should_see_content_in_the_x_iframe

      @Then("^I should see the (.*) iframe$") public static void i_should_see_content_in_the_x_iframe​(java.lang.String iFrameName) throws java.lang.Throwable
      Identifies an iframe and switches to it, if it exists.

      Gherkin Examples:

      • I should see the Third Party iframe
      • I should see the Provider Search iframe
      • I should see the Facebook iframe
      Parameters:
      iFrameName - String the name of the iframe element on the page object.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Throwable - Passes through any errors to the executing code.
      See Also:
      i_verify_an_element_exists(String, String), PageManager.switchToIFrame()
